poem.title: After the Rout
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Let's not lament the makars or forgotten songs, but thank
The readers in whom Henryson's survived obliteration.
I'm not falling  off the map, quite the reverse:
It's coming away like gauze, for this
Is the promised earth. Lank grasses
Assuage the lack on which the world's vanity
Draws its flickering charm. The drab skylark
Final plummet silent.
